description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: More than 4 $$s instances found in netlist.\n
Signal $$s has $$d DCCs on it, maximally 4 is allowed.\n
DCC comp "$$s" has no input signal. Please correct the design.
PCS comp '$$s' cannot be locked at site '$$s' due to regional clock conflict as follows.\n
PCS '$$s' cannot be locked at site '$$s' due to unbonded APIOs in package '$$s'.\n
Fail to place Multi-Quad PCSs.\n
Unable to place PCS comp '$$s'; no legal site available.\n
Invalid NC_NODE '$$s' connecting PCS and APIO site '$$s'.\n
failed to place PCS comp '$$s' due to regional clock constraints as follows.\n
PCS comp $$s driving multiple PCS thru PCS_REFCLK_TO_NQ pin.\n
PIO site "$$s / $$s" cannot be used as a DQS pin.
DQFBUF site "$$s" cannot be used for any DDR group.
PIO site "$$s/$$s" is not a DQS pin.
DQS data pad "$$s" uses site "$$s/$$s", which is out of range.
The design cannot be placed due to incompatible Vccio="$$s" (for PIO comp "$$s") vs Vccio="$$s" (for PIO comp "$$s" in the same DDR bus) in the same I/O bank.
The DQS strobe comp "$$s" of a DDR bus uses "$$s" instead of SSTL25/SSTL18/SSTL15 as its sysIO signaling standard.
A DQ data PIO comp "$$s" of a DDR bus (with DQS strobe comp "$$s") uses "$$s" instead of SSTL25/SSTL18/SSTL15 as its sysIO signaling standard.
The DQS strobe "$$s" uses sysIO type "$$s", while the DQS data pad "$$s" uses a different sysIO type "$$s", which is not allowed.
Dangling signal "$$s" is driving $$s input of IOLOGIC comp "$$s".
The $$s input of IOLOGIC comp "$$s" (signal "$$s") is driven by comp "$$s", which is not a DQSBUF.
The $$s input of IOLOGIC comp "$$s" (signal "$$s") is not driven by the $$s output of DQSBUF comp "$$s".
The $$s output of DQSBUF comp "$$s" (signal "$$s") is driving comp "$$s", which is not an IOLOGIC.
The $$s output of DQSBUF comp "$$s" (signal "$$s") is not driving the $$s input of IOLOGIC comp "$$s".
The ECLKO output of ECLKSYNC comp "$$s" is driving a non-ECLK load comp "$$s". Signal "$$s" may be hard to route.
The number of signals that drive the ECLKDQSR input of IDDRs in this design is $$d, which exceeds the device limit of 3 (because these signals have to use ECLK2).
-- signal [$$d]: "$$s".\n
ECP3 only allows one ECLK per side (i.e. ECLK2) to drive the ECLKDQSR input of IOLOGIC directly.

Illegal DDR connections found: The SCLK inputs of DQSBUF comp "$$s" and DQSIOL comp "$$s" of the same DDR group are either driven by different signals, or they are the same signal but with different polarity. Per ECP3 architecture, they have to come from the same signal and have the same polarity, otherwise the design is unrouteable.
The number of ECLK signals that drive the CLK input of DQSDLL comps in this design is $$d, which exceeds the device limit of 2 (because these signals have to use ECLK1 on left/right sides).
-- [$$d] Signal "$$s" ==> DQSDLL comp "$$s".\n
Signal "$$s" drives the DQSI input of DQSBUF comps "$$s" and "$$s" at the same time, which is illegal for ECP3 devices. Please correct the design.

The design has an illegal bi-directional IDDRX1/ODDRX1 (PIO comp "$$s"). For more details, please contact Lattice Semiconductor technical support at 1-800-LATTICE, or 503-268-8001, or techsupport@latticesemi.com.
PIO comp "$$s" has an illegal standalone generic ODDRX1 on its IOLOGIC side (i.e. with its SCLK/DQCLK1 tied together).
Please check your design carefully.
DDR bus with $$s comp "$$s" has $$d edge clocks, which exceeds the device limit (maximum 2).
ECLK signal [$$d]: "$$s\
The DQS bus with $$s comp "$$s" is not assigned yet.
DDR group (with $$s comp "$$s") has illegal DDR type combination "$$s+ODDRX1(gen)".
Unable to place DQSBUF comp "$$s".
>>> [iter:$$d, iter2:$$d] placed DQ PIO comp "$$s" on site "$$s/$$s".
Initial placement of DQS data pad $$s is unsuccessful.
Could not find a valid range for PIO comp "$$s".
Initial placement of DQS strobe "$$s" is unsuccessful.
DDR assignment finished unsuccessfully.
INTERROR: DSP comp $$s has been processed
DSP comp $$s appears in multiple DSP groups\n
\nInitial placement of DSP components failed due to insufficient DSP blocks.\n
comp '$$s': Loop found in forming shiftchain for DSP\n
illegal locking of DSP comps as follows.\n
INTERROR: DSP comp '$$s' with site=0\n
>>> P2E signal "$$s" is going to be assigned in another bank "$$d".
//// it=$$d ==> ECLK "$$s", PIO driver site: "$$s/$$s".
Edge clock signal "$$s" (driven by comp "$$s") has to use a CIB (i.e. general routing); therefore, it may suffer from excessive delay or skew.
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s" because they are incompatible.
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s" because this comp has been placed on site "$$s" already.
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s" because this site has been occupied by another comp "$$s".
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s" because this site has been prohibited.
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s".
Cannot place comp "$$s" on site "$$s / $$s" because this site has been booked by a quadrant clock.
Cannot place the eclk driver comp "$$s" on PIO site "$$s / $$s" [site is out of PIO comp's PGROUP range].
Cannot place the eclk driver comp "$$s" on PIO site "$$s / $$s" [I/O banking rule conflict].
Cannot place the eclk driver comp "$$s" on PIO site "$$s / $$s" [potential I/O banking rule conflict].
Cannot place the eclk driver comp "$$s" on PLL site "$$s" [dedicated PLL inputs should be used].
ECLK "$$s", driver "$$s": site "$$s", pin "$$s" does not directly drive an ECLK.
B2E clock signal "$$s": cannot use site "$$s" for driver comp "$$s" [due to B2E connectivity].
ECLK "$$s", driver "$$s": cannot use site "$$s" because it has already been assigned to something else.
ECLK "$$s", driver "$$s": site "$$s" does not drive "$$s" directly.
ECLK "$$s", driver "$$s": cannot use site "$$s" because "$$s" has been assigned to signal "$$s".
Signal "$$s" cannot be assigned to use "$$s".
Cannot place the eclk driver comp "$$s" on site "$$s / $$s" because I/O placement failed for this comp.
Cannot use CIB "$$d" for ECLK "$$s" (driver comp "$$s") because it has been used already.
Cannot use CIB "$$d" for ECLK "$$s" (driver comp "$$s") because this site does not drive "$$s".
Cannot use CIB "$$d" for ECLK "$$s" (driver comp "$$s") because "$$s" has been used by signal "$$s".
*** ECLK signal "$$s" ==> "$$s" (ECLK index: $$d)
ECLKSYNC comp "$$s" drives edge clock "$$s"; however, the ECLKI input of this ECLKSYNC comp is dangling. Please check your design carefully.
Cannot find ECLKSYNC site for "$$s".
Failed to assign ECLK to signal "$$s".
Edge clock signal "$$s": PIO driver comp "$$s" will be placed along with other PIO comps.
Edge clock signal "$$s": driver comp "$$s" cannot be placed.
The number of Primary2Edge signals is $$d, which exceeds maximum of $$d.
Some of the load comps of ECLK "$$s" are locked to an invalid I/O bank "$$d". The PRIMARY2EDGE preference will be ignored.
ECLK "$$s" will not use PRIMARY2EDGE because all its load comps are on the same side of the device.
ECLK signal "$$s" cannot be fully assigned to use PRIMARY2EDGE, therefore it may suffer from large skew.
>>> P2E clock: "$$s" ==> ECLK index: $$d, CIB idx: $$d
ECLK signal "$$s" cannot be fully assigned to use PRIMARY2EDGE, therefore they may suffer from large skew.
ECLK signal "$$s" cannot be assigned to PRIMARY2EDGE due to limited # of resources available.
According to its connectivity, PLL comp "$$s" has to be placed on PLL site "$$s"; however, it is impossible because this site is $$s$$s.
ECLK load PIO comp "$$s" has been placed on I/O bank $$d, which is inconsistent with the assignment of its ECLK signal "$$s".
User preference on ECLK load comp "$$s" is inconsistent with the assignment of its ECLK signal "$$s".
PIO comp "$$s" has conflict requirements between PIO PGROUP range (from "$$s/$$s" to "$$s/$$s") and ECLK assignment (ECLK "$$s" on the $$s side).
PIO comp "$$s" has conflict requirements between PIO PGROUP range (from "$$s/$$s" to "$$s/$$s") and ECLK assignment (ECLK "$$s" from bank $$d to $$d).
Edge clock signal "$$s" probably has not been assigned yet.
IOLOGIC comp "$$s" (driven by ECLK signal "$$s") cannot be placed on its optimal site, therefore general routing has to be used to route from the ECLK to this comp.
// check_and_place_gddr_eclk() - bank=$$d, eclk_idx=$$d: eclk_sig="$$s\
// + drv_comp="$$s", drv_site="$$s/$$s" [bank $$d]
// + drv_comp="$$s", drv_site="$$s\
// + drv_idx=$$d
Unable to assign signal "$$s" as an ECLK on the side of I/O bank $$d.
Unable to assign signal "$$s" as an ECLK.
Unsupported PRIMARY2EDGE preference for clock signal "$$s" will be ignored.
Invalid bank # "$$d" specified in BANK VCCIO preference.
Violation of BANK VCCIO preference at bank $$d
>>> init_place_piopgroup(): Placed PIO PGROUP comp "$$s" on "$$s/$$s".
init_place_piopgroup(): Failed to place PIO PGROUP comp "$$s".

*** End of I/O bank info ***

Signal "$$s" (driven by PCS comp "$$s") cannot drive DCS input.
DCC comp "$$s" is not placed yet.
Signal "$$s" is driven by $$d DCC comps. Only $$d is allowed.
Illegal locking of DSP comp $$s at $$s; DSP group is out of chip boundary.
